result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keymon Futrell-Hill

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keymon Futrell-Hill in court.  
Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Keymon Futrell-Hill.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  
Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.

HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE KIES. 

Off record discussions held. Due to Court congestion case is adjourned.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Parties notified.

Defendant Keymon Futrell-Hill in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  At the request of defense, the court set this matter for plea and sentencing.    Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  mn  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Attorney Lamke is unavailable for court on 6/15/22 and requested the date for scheduling to  5/26/22 at 2:30 in Br 45.  This clerk changed the date for the hearing.  mn

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs appeared in Court for Matthew Adrian Lamke, defendant Keymon Futrell-Hill in Court, in custody.  Alexandria Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin..  Defendant appeared in person to clear the warrant that was issued on 5/2/22.  Statements made.  The court reinstated the signature bond and ordered this matter adjourned for scheduling in Br 45.  mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court notified that defendant wants to clear their warrant. Court scheduled a return on warrant date with parties via email. Return on Warrant scheduled for May 9th, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Scheduling Conference. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.

Defendant Keymon Futrell-Hill in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested an additional scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keymon Futrell-Hill in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Allahlonah D.G.; Christopher D.H.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keymon Futrell-Hill in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Keymon Futrell-Hill in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keymon Futrell-Hill appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
